intro: Persoonia micranthera, commonly known as the small-thorned geebung, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight waxy coating, while the flowers are usually white or pink in color. Persoonia micranthera is known for its ability to withstand coastal winds and salt spray, making it a hardy and resilient species.
